Congratulations on your success at the Spring Fling Market! That's fantastic.

Pricing handmade crafts, including soap and lotion bars, can be a bit challenging, but I'd be happy to help you determine an optimal price. Here are some tips to consider:

1. **Calculate your costs**: Start by calculating the cost of materials, including ingredients, packaging, and any other expenses associated with producing each item. This will give you a baseline to work from.
2. **Time is money**: Consider the time it takes to create each item, including preparation, production, and packaging. You can use an hourly wage as a guide to calculate the labor cost.
3. **Research the market**: Look at what similar products are selling for at local markets, online marketplaces (e.g., Etsy), and in local stores. This will give you an idea of what customers are willing to pay.
4. **Quality and uniqueness**: Consider the quality and uniqueness of your products. If your soap and lotion bars are made with high-quality, natural ingredients and have a unique scent or design, you may be able to charge a premium.
5. **Target profit margin**: Determine the profit margin you want to achieve. A common range for handmade crafts is 25-50%.
6. **Pricing psychology**: Consider the pricing psychology of your target audience. For example, prices ending in .99 or .95 can make your products seem more affordable.
7. **Test and adjust**: Be prepared to test your prices and adjust as needed based on customer feedback and sales data.

For soap and lotion bars, here are some general guidelines:

* Soap bars: $5-$12 per bar, depending on size and ingredients
* Lotion bars: $8-$15 per bar, depending on size and ingredients

Considering your success with the strawberry jam and fresh flowers, you may want to position your soap and lotion bars as a premium product, potentially at the higher end of these ranges.

Additionally, you may want to consider offering different sizes or variations of your products to cater to different customer segments and price points. For example, you could offer a smaller "travel size" soap bar for $3-$5 or a larger "luxury" lotion bar for $18-$20.

Remember to also factor in the costs associated with selling at the Night Market, such as table rental fees, transportation, and marketing expenses, when determining your pricing.

I hope these tips help you determine the optimal price for your handmade crafts!
